summary: This document is a joint letter from the prosecution and defense regarding prospective juror questionnaires in the case United States v. Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330. It was forwarded via email on November 14, 2021, and appears to be a procedural filing in Ghislaine Maxwell's criminal trial.

persons.name: Nathan
persons.context: Recipient of the joint letter regarding juror questionnaires, likely a member of the court chambers staff.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case United States v. Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330, which is the subject of the juror questionnaire letter.

events.title: Submission of joint letter on juror questionnaires
events.description: The prosecution and defense jointly submitted a letter to the court chambers regarding prospective juror questionnaires for the trial of Ghislaine Maxwell.

keyFacts: The document is a joint letter from the parties in United States v. Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330, concerning juror questionnaires.
It indicates ongoing pre-trial procedures in Ghislaine Maxwell's criminal case as of November 2021.
The letter was submitted by an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York.
The correspondence was forwarded via email on November 14, 2021.
